introduction.title: Sacred Heritage of Brijghat
introduction.description: The oldest and most revered Dandi-Wada and Temple, established by Sri Sri 1008 Sri Dandi Swami Omkar Ashram Ji Maharaj, stands as a testament to spiritual enlightenment. This sacred establishment gave birth to what is now known as Brijghat, fostering a thriving community around its spiritual core.

spiritualLegacy.title: Spiritual Legacy
spiritualLegacy.description: Home to an ancient and sacred Shivlingam, the ashram serves as a sanctuary for Dandi Sanyasis, especially during the Chatur-Masa period, providing selfless service and spiritual guidance.

divinePurpose.title: Divine Purpose
divinePurpose.description: Our mission is to spread प्रभु भक्ति (devotion to the Lord) among all people and provide selfless service to Dandi Sanyasis, maintaining the sacred traditions of the Shankaracharya lineage.

sacredLocation.title: Sacred Location
sacredLocation.description: Situated just two minutes from the holy Ganga river in Brijghat, the ashram provides a serene environment for spiritual practices, meditation, and religious ceremonies.

heritage.title: Our Heritage
heritage.description: Dandi Omkar Ashram, situated in the sacred town of Brijghat, GarhMukteshwar, is a spiritual center deeply rooted in the Shankaracharya tradition. The ashram serves as a sanctuary for Dandi Sanyasis, who are monks following the highest order of renunciation in the Advaita Vedanta tradition.

significance.title: Spiritual Significance
significance.description: The ashram follows the teachings and principles established by Adi Shankaracharya, the great Indian philosopher and saint. It maintains the sacred traditions of the Dandi Sanyasi order, which represents the pinnacle of monastic life in the Vedantic tradition.

dailyLife.title: Daily Life at the Ashram
dailyLife.description: The daily routine at Dandi Omkar Ashram revolves around spiritual practices, including meditation, vedic chanting, and the study of sacred texts. The ashram provides a peaceful environment for spiritual seekers to deepen their understanding of Vedantic philosophy and practice spiritual disciplines.

location.title: Location
location.description: Located in Brijghat, GarhMukteshwar, Uttar Pradesh, the ashram is situated in a region known for its spiritual significance. The serene environment, combined with the holy atmosphere of the area, makes it an ideal place for spiritual practice and contemplation.
